measure.name: build_residential_hpxml
measure.modeler_description: The measure handles geometry by 1) translating high-level geometry inputs (conditioned floor area, number of stories, etc.) to 3D closed-form geometry in an OpenStudio model and then 2) mapping the OpenStudio surfaces to HPXML surfaces (using surface type, boundary condition, area, orientation, etc.). Like surfaces are collapsed into a single surface with aggregate surface area. Note: OS-HPXML default values can be found in the documentation or can be seen by using the 'apply_defaults' argument.

argument.name: hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the HPXML file.

argument.name: existing_hpxml_path
argument.description: Absolute/relative path of the existing HPXML file. If not provided, a new HPXML file with one Building element is created. If provided, a new Building element will be appended to this HPXML file (e.g., to create a multifamily HPXML file describing multiple dwelling units).

argument.name: whole_sfa_or_mf_building_sim
argument.description: If the HPXML file represents a single family-attached/multifamily building with multiple dwelling units defined, specifies whether to run the HPXML file as a single whole building model.

argument.name: software_info_program_used
argument.description: The name of the software program used.

argument.name: software_info_program_version
argument.description: The version of the software program used.

argument.name: schedules_filepaths
argument.description: Absolute/relative paths of csv files containing user-specified detailed schedules. If multiple files, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_types
argument.description: Specifies the unavailable period types. Possible types are column names defined in unavailable_periods.csv: Vacancy, Power Outage, No Space Heating, No Space Cooling. If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_dates
argument.description: Specifies the unavailable period date ranges. Enter a date range like "Dec 15 - Jan 15". Optionally, can enter hour of the day like "Dec 15 2 - Jan 15 20" (start hour can be 0 through 23 and end hour can be 1 through 24). If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list.

argument.name: schedules_unavailable_period_window_natvent_availabilities
argument.display_name: Schedules: Unavailable Period Window Natural Ventilation Availabilities
argument.description: The availability of the natural ventilation schedule during unavailable periods. Valid choices are: regular schedule, always available, always unavailable. If multiple periods, use a comma-separated list. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Unavailable Periods) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_timestep
argument.description: Value must be a divisor of 60. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Jan 1 - Dec 31'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_run_period_calendar_year
argument.display_name: Simulation Control: Run Period Calendar Year
argument.description: This numeric field should contain the calendar year that determines the start day of week. If you are running simulations using AMY weather files, the value entered for calendar year will not be used; it will be overridden by the actual year found in the AMY weather file. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_daylight_saving_enabled
argument.description: Whether to use daylight saving. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Site) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_daylight_saving_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Mar 15 - Dec 15'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Site) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_temperature_capacitance_multiplier
argument.description: Affects the transient calculation of indoor air temperatures. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_defrost_model_type
argument.description: Research feature to select the type of defrost model. Use standard for default E+ defrost setting. Use advanced for an improved model that better accounts for load and energy use during defrost; using advanced may impact simulation runtime. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Simulation Control) is used.

argument.name: simulation_control_onoff_thermostat_deadband
argument.display_name: Simulation Control: HVAC On-Off Thermostat Deadband
argument.description: Research feature to model on-off thermostat deadband and start-up degradation for single or two speed AC/ASHP systems, and realistic time-based staging for two speed AC/ASHP systems. Currently only supported with 1 min timestep.

argument.name: simulation_control_heat_pump_backup_heating_capacity_increment
argument.display_name: Simulation Control: Heat Pump Backup Heating Capacity Increment
argument.description: Research feature to model capacity increment of multi-stage heat pump backup systems with time-based staging. Only applies to air-source heat pumps where Backup Type is 'integrated' and Backup Fuel Type is 'electricity'. Currently only supported with 1 min timestep.

argument.name: site_type
argument.description: The type of site. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_shielding_of_home
argument.description: Presence of nearby buildings, trees, obstructions for infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_soil_and_moisture_type
argument.description: Type of soil and moisture. This is used to inform ground conductivity and diffusivity. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_ground_conductivity
argument.description: Conductivity of the ground soil. If provided, overrides the previous site and moisture type input.

argument.name: site_ground_diffusivity
argument.description: Diffusivity of the ground soil. If provided, overrides the previous site and moisture type input.

argument.name: site_iecc_zone
argument.description: IECC zone of the home address.

argument.name: site_city
argument.description: City/municipality of the home address.

argument.name: site_state_code
argument.description: State code of the home address. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_zip_code
argument.description: Zip code of the home address. Either this or the Weather Station: EnergyPlus Weather (EPW) Filepath input below must be provided.

argument.name: site_time_zone_utc_offset
argument.description: Time zone UTC offset of the home address. Must be between -12 and 14. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_elevation
argument.description: Elevation of the home address. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_latitude
argument.description: Latitude of the home address. Must be between -90 and 90. Use negative values for southern hemisphere. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: site_longitude
argument.description: Longitude of the home address. Must be between -180 and 180. Use negative values for the western hemisphere. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Site) is used.

argument.name: weather_station_epw_filepath
argument.description: Path of the EPW file. Either this or the Site: Zip Code input above must be provided.

argument.name: year_built
argument.description: The year the building was built.

argument.name: unit_multiplier
argument.description: The number of similar dwelling units. EnergyPlus simulation results will be multiplied this value. If not provided, defaults to 1.

argument.name: geometry_unit_type
argument.description: The type of dwelling unit. Use single-family attached for a dwelling unit with 1 or more stories, attached units to one or both sides, and no units above/below. Use apartment unit for a dwelling unit with 1 story, attached units to one, two, or three sides, and units above and/or below.

argument.name: geometry_unit_left_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Left Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic left wall.

argument.name: geometry_unit_right_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Right Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic right wall.

argument.name: geometry_unit_front_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Front Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic front wall, for example, the unit is adjacent to a conditioned corridor.

argument.name: geometry_unit_back_wall_is_adiabatic
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Back Wall Is Adiabatic
argument.description: Presence of an adiabatic back wall.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_floors_above_grade
argument.display_name: Geometry: Unit Number of Floors Above Grade
argument.description: The number of floors above grade in the unit. Attic type ConditionedAttic is included. Assumed to be 1 for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_unit_cfa
argument.description: The total floor area of the unit's conditioned space (including any conditioned basement floor area).

argument.name: geometry_unit_aspect_ratio
argument.description: The ratio of front/back wall length to left/right wall length for the unit, excluding any protruding garage wall area.

argument.name: geometry_unit_orientation
argument.description: The unit's orientation is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bedrooms
argument.description: The number of bedrooms in the unit.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_bathrooms
argument.description: The number of bathrooms in the unit. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Construction) is used.

argument.name: geometry_unit_num_occupants
argument.description: The number of occupants in the unit. If not provided, an *asset* calculation is performed assuming standard occupancy, in which various end use defaults (e.g., plug loads, appliances, and hot water usage) are calculated based on Number of Bedrooms and Conditioned Floor Area per ANSI/RESNET/ICC 301. If provided, an *operational* calculation is instead performed in which the end use defaults to reflect real-world data (where possible).

argument.name: geometry_building_num_units
argument.description: The number of units in the building. Required for single-family attached and apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_average_ceiling_height
argument.description: Average distance from the floor to the ceiling.

argument.name: geometry_unit_height_above_grade
argument.description: Describes the above-grade height of apartment units on upper floors or homes above ambient or belly-and-wing foundations. It is defined as the height of the lowest conditioned floor above grade and is used to calculate the wind speed for the infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Construction) is used.

argument.name: geometry_garage_width
argument.description: The width of the garage. Enter zero for no garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_garage_depth
argument.description: The depth of the garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_garage_protrusion
argument.description: The fraction of the garage that is protruding from the conditioned space. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_garage_position
argument.description: The position of the garage. Only applies to single-family detached units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_type
argument.description: The foundation type of the building. Foundation types ConditionedBasement and ConditionedCrawlspace are not allowed for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_height
argument.description: The height of the foundation (e.g., 3ft for crawlspace, 8ft for basement). Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: geometry_foundation_height_above_grade
argument.description: The depth above grade of the foundation wall. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: geometry_rim_joist_height
argument.description: The height of the rim joists. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: geometry_attic_type
argument.description: The attic type of the building. Attic type ConditionedAttic is not allowed for apartment units.

argument.name: geometry_roof_type
argument.description: The roof type of the building. Ignored if the building has a flat roof.

argument.name: geometry_roof_pitch
argument.description: The roof pitch of the attic. Ignored if the building has a flat roof.

argument.name: geometry_eaves_depth
argument.description: The eaves depth of the roof.

argument.name: neighbor_front_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the front (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_back_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the back (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_left_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the left (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_right_distance
argument.description: The distance between the unit and the neighboring building to the right (not including eaves). A value of zero indicates no neighbors. Used for shading.

argument.name: neighbor_front_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the front. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Neighbor Building) is used.

argument.name: neighbor_back_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the back. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Neighbor Building) is used.

argument.name: neighbor_left_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the left. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Neighbor Building) is used.

argument.name: neighbor_right_height
argument.description: The height of the neighboring building to the right. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Neighbor Building) is used.

argument.name: floor_over_foundation_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the floor over the foundation. Ignored if the building has a slab-on-grade foundation.

argument.name: floor_over_garage_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the floor over the garage. Ignored unless the building has a garage under conditioned space.

argument.name: floor_type
argument.description: The type of floors.

argument.name: foundation_wall_type
argument.description: The material type of the foundation wall. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Foundation Walls) is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_thickness
argument.description: The thickness of the foundation wall. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Foundation Walls) is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_r
argument.description: Nominal R-value for the foundation wall insulation. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_location
argument.description: Whether the insulation is on the interior or exterior of the foundation wall. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_distance_to_top
argument.display_name: Foundation Wall: Insulation Distance To Top
argument.description: The distance from the top of the foundation wall to the top of the foundation wall insulation. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Foundation Walls) is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_insulation_distance_to_bottom
argument.display_name: Foundation Wall: Insulation Distance To Bottom
argument.description: The distance from the top of the foundation wall to the bottom of the foundation wall insulation. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Foundation Walls) is used.

argument.name: foundation_wall_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the foundation walls. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. If provided, overrides the previous foundation wall insulation inputs. If not provided, it is ignored.

argument.name: rim_joist_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the rim joists. Only applies to basements/crawlspaces. Required if a rim joist height is provided.

argument.name: slab_perimeter_insulation_r
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the vertical slab perimeter insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_perimeter_insulation_depth
argument.description: Depth from grade to bottom of vertical slab perimeter insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_exterior_horizontal_insulation_r
argument.display_name: Slab: Exterior Horizontal Insulation Nominal R-value
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the slab exterior horizontal insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_exterior_horizontal_insulation_width
argument.description: Width of the slab exterior horizontal insulation measured from the exterior surface of the vertical slab perimeter insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_exterior_horizontal_insulation_depth_below_grade
argument.display_name: Slab: Exterior Horizontal Insulation Depth Below Grade
argument.description: Depth of the slab exterior horizontal insulation measured from the top surface of the slab exterior horizontal insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_under_insulation_r
argument.display_name: Slab: Under Slab Insulation Nominal R-value
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the horizontal under slab insulation. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_under_insulation_width
argument.description: Width from slab edge inward of horizontal under-slab insulation. Enter 999 to specify that the under slab insulation spans the entire slab. Applies to slab-on-grade foundations and basement/crawlspace floors.

argument.name: slab_thickness
argument.description: The thickness of the slab. Zero can be entered if there is a dirt floor instead of a slab. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Slabs) is used.

argument.name: slab_carpet_fraction
argument.description: Fraction of the slab floor area that is carpeted. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Slabs) is used.

argument.name: slab_carpet_r
argument.description: R-value of the slab carpet. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Slabs) is used.

argument.name: ceiling_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value for the ceiling (attic floor).

argument.name: roof_material_type
argument.description: The material type of the roof. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Roofs) is used.

argument.name: roof_color
argument.description: The color of the roof. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Roofs) is used.

argument.name: roof_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value of the roof.

argument.name: radiant_barrier_attic_location
argument.description: The location of the radiant barrier in the attic.

argument.name: radiant_barrier_grade
argument.description: The grade of the radiant barrier in the attic. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Roofs) is used.

argument.name: wall_type
argument.description: The type of walls.

argument.name: wall_siding_type
argument.description: The siding type of the walls. Also applies to rim joists. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Walls) is used.

argument.name: wall_color
argument.description: The color of the walls. Also applies to rim joists. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Walls) is used.

argument.name: wall_assembly_r
argument.description: Assembly R-value of the walls.

argument.name: window_front_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's front facade. Enter 0 if specifying Front Window Area instead. If the front wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_back_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's back facade. Enter 0 if specifying Back Window Area instead. If the back wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_left_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's left facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Left Window Area instead. If the left wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_right_wwr
argument.description: The ratio of window area to wall area for the unit's right facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Right Window Area instead. If the right wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_front
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's front facade. Enter 0 if specifying Front Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the front wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_back
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's back facade. Enter 0 if specifying Back Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the back wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_left
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's left facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Left Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the left wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_area_right
argument.description: The amount of window area on the unit's right facade (when viewed from the front). Enter 0 if specifying Right Window-to-Wall Ratio instead. If the right wall is adiabatic, the value will be ignored.

argument.name: window_aspect_ratio
argument.description: Ratio of window height to width.

argument.name: window_fraction_operable
argument.description: Fraction of windows that are operable. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Windows) is used.

argument.name: window_natvent_availability
argument.description: For operable windows, the number of days/week that windows can be opened by occupants for natural ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Windows) is used.

argument.name: window_ufactor
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC U-factor.

argument.name: window_shgc
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC solar heat gain coefficient.

argument.name: window_interior_shading_type
argument.description: Type of window interior shading. Summer/winter shading coefficients can be provided below instead. If neither is provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Interior Shading) is used.

argument.name: window_interior_shading_winter
argument.description: Interior shading coefficient for the winter season, which if provided overrides the shading type input. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Interior Shading) is used.

argument.name: window_interior_shading_summer
argument.description: Interior shading coefficient for the summer season, which if provided overrides the shading type input. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Interior Shading) is used.

argument.name: window_exterior_shading_type
argument.description: Type of window exterior shading. Summer/winter shading coefficients can be provided below instead. If neither is provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Exterior Shading) is used.

argument.name: window_exterior_shading_winter
argument.description: Exterior shading coefficient for the winter season, which if provided overrides the shading type input. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Exterior Shading) is used.

argument.name: window_exterior_shading_summer
argument.description: Exterior shading coefficient for the summer season, which if provided overrides the shading type input. 1.0 indicates no reduction in solar gain, 0.85 indicates 15% reduction, etc. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Exterior Shading) is used.

argument.name: window_shading_summer_season
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'May 1 - Sep 30'. Defines the summer season for purposes of shading coefficients; the rest of the year is assumed to be winter. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Windows) is used.

argument.name: window_insect_screens
argument.description: The type of insect screens, if present. If not provided, assumes there are no insect screens.

argument.name: window_storm_type
argument.description: The type of storm, if present. If not provided, assumes there is no storm.

argument.name: overhangs_front_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the front facade.

argument.name: overhangs_front_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Front Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the front facade.

argument.name: overhangs_front_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Front Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the front facade.

argument.name: overhangs_back_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the back facade.

argument.name: overhangs_back_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Back Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the back facade.

argument.name: overhangs_back_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Back Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the back facade.

argument.name: overhangs_left_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the left facade.

argument.name: overhangs_left_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Left Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the left facade.

argument.name: overhangs_left_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Left Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the left facade.

argument.name: overhangs_right_depth
argument.description: The depth of overhangs for windows for the right facade.

argument.name: overhangs_right_distance_to_top_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Right Distance to Top of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the top of window for the right facade.

argument.name: overhangs_right_distance_to_bottom_of_window
argument.display_name: Overhangs: Right Distance to Bottom of Window
argument.description: The overhangs distance to the bottom of window for the right facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_front
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's front conditioned roof facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_back
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's back conditioned roof facade.

argument.name: skylight_area_left
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's left conditioned roof facade (when viewed from the front).

argument.name: skylight_area_right
argument.description: The amount of skylight area on the unit's right conditioned roof facade (when viewed from the front).

argument.name: skylight_ufactor
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC U-factor.

argument.name: skylight_shgc
argument.description: Full-assembly NFRC solar heat gain coefficient.

argument.name: skylight_storm_type
argument.description: The type of storm, if present. If not provided, assumes there is no storm.

argument.name: door_area
argument.description: The area of the opaque door(s).

argument.name: door_rvalue
argument.description: R-value of the opaque door(s).

argument.name: air_leakage_leakiness_description
argument.description: Qualitative description of infiltration. If provided, the Year Built of the home is required. Either provide this input or provide a numeric air leakage value below.

argument.name: air_leakage_units
argument.description: The unit of measure for the air leakage if providing a numeric air leakage value.

argument.name: air_leakage_house_pressure
argument.description: The house pressure relative to outside if providing a numeric air leakage value. Required when units are ACH or CFM.

argument.name: air_leakage_value
argument.description: Numeric air leakage value. For 'EffectiveLeakageArea', provide value in sq. in. If provided, overrides Leakiness Description input.

argument.name: air_leakage_type
argument.description: Type of air leakage if providing a numeric air leakage value. If 'unit total', represents the total infiltration to the unit as measured by a compartmentalization test, in which case the air leakage value will be adjusted by the ratio of exterior envelope surface area to total envelope surface area. Otherwise, if 'unit exterior only', represents the infiltration to the unit from outside only as measured by a guarded test. Required when unit type is single-family attached or apartment unit.

argument.name: air_leakage_has_flue_or_chimney_in_conditioned_space
argument.display_name: Air Leakage: Has Flue or Chimney in Conditioned Space
argument.description: Presence of flue or chimney with combustion air from conditioned space; used for infiltration model. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Flue or Chimney) is used.

argument.name: heating_system_type
argument.description: The type of heating system. Use 'none' if there is no heating system or if there is a heat pump serving a heating load.

choice.value: Shared Boiler w/ Ductless Fan Coil
choice.display_name: Shared Boiler w/ Ductless Fan Coil

argument.name: heating_system_fuel
argument.description: The fuel type of the heating system. Ignored for ElectricResistance.

argument.name: heating_system_heating_efficiency
argument.display_name: Heating System: Rated AFUE or Percent
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_heating_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heating system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see HPXML Heating Systems) is used.

argument.name: heating_system_heating_autosizing_factor
argument.description: The capacity scaling factor applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, 1.0 is used.

argument.name: heating_system_heating_autosizing_limit
argument.description: The maximum capacity limit applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, no limit is used.

argument.name: heating_system_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Heating System: Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heating load served by the heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_pilot_light
argument.description: The fuel usage of the pilot light. Applies only to Furnace, WallFurnace, FloorFurnace, Stove, Boiler, and Fireplace with non-electric fuel type. If not provided, assumes no pilot light.

argument.name: heating_system_airflow_defect_ratio
argument.description: The airflow defect ratio, defined as (InstalledAirflow - DesignAirflow) / DesignAirflow, of the heating system per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no airflow defect. Applies only to Furnace. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: cooling_system_type
argument.description: The type of cooling system. Use 'none' if there is no cooling system or if there is a heat pump serving a cooling load.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of the cooling system. System types central air conditioner and mini-split use SEER or SEER2. System types room air conditioner and packaged terminal air conditioner use EER or CEER. Ignored for system type evaporative cooler.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_efficiency
argument.description: The rated efficiency value of the cooling system. Ignored for evaporative cooler.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_compressor_type
argument.description: The compressor type of the cooling system. Only applies to central air conditioner and mini-split. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Central Air Conditioner, Mini-Split Air Conditioner) is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_sensible_heat_fraction
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Cooling Sensible Heat Fraction
argument.description: The sensible heat fraction of the cooling system. Ignored for evaporative cooler. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Central Air Conditioner, Room Air Conditioner, Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner, Mini-Split Air Conditioner) is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_capacity
argument.description: The output cooling capacity of the cooling system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see Central Air Conditioner, Room Air Conditioner, Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner, Evaporative Cooler, Mini-Split Air Conditioner) is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_autosizing_factor
argument.description: The capacity scaling factor applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, 1.0 is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_cooling_autosizing_limit
argument.description: The maximum capacity limit applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, no limit is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_fraction_cool_load_served
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Fraction Cool Load Served
argument.description: The cooling load served by the cooling system.

argument.name: cooling_system_is_ducted
argument.description: Whether the cooling system is ducted or not. Only used for mini-split and evaporative cooler. It's assumed that central air conditioner is ducted, and room air conditioner and packaged terminal air conditioner are not ducted.

argument.name: cooling_system_airflow_defect_ratio
argument.description: The airflow defect ratio, defined as (InstalledAirflow - DesignAirflow) / DesignAirflow, of the cooling system per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no airflow defect. Applies only to central air conditioner and ducted mini-split. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: cooling_system_charge_defect_ratio
argument.description: The refrigerant charge defect ratio, defined as (InstalledCharge - DesignCharge) / DesignCharge, of the cooling system per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no refrigerant charge defect. Applies only to central air conditioner and mini-split. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: cooling_system_crankcase_heater_watts
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Crankcase Heater Power Watts
argument.description: Cooling system crankcase heater power consumption in Watts. Applies only to central air conditioner, room air conditioner, packaged terminal air conditioner and mini-split. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Central Air Conditioner, Room Air Conditioner, Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner, Mini-Split Air Conditioner) is used.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_fuel
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Fuel Type
argument.description: The fuel type of the heating system integrated into cooling system. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_efficiency_percent
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Efficiency
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the heating system integrated into cooling system. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_capacity
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Heating Capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heating system integrated into cooling system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see Room Air Conditioner, Packaged Terminal Air Conditioner) is used. Only used for room air conditioner and packaged terminal air conditioner.

argument.name: cooling_system_integrated_heating_system_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Cooling System: Integrated Heating System Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heating load served by the heating system integrated into cooling system. Only used for packaged terminal air conditioner and room air conditioner.

argument.name: heat_pump_type
argument.description: The type of heat pump. Use 'none' if there is no heat pump.

choice.value: room air conditioner with reverse cycle
choice.display_name: room air conditioner with reverse cycle

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_efficiency_type
argument.description: The heating efficiency type of heat pump. System types air-to-air and mini-split use HSPF or HSPF2. System types ground-to-air, packaged terminal heat pump and room air conditioner with reverse cycle use COP.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_efficiency
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_efficiency_type
argument.description: The cooling efficiency type of heat pump. System types air-to-air and mini-split use SEER or SEER2. System types ground-to-air, packaged terminal heat pump and room air conditioner with reverse cycle use EER.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_efficiency
argument.description: The rated cooling efficiency value of the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_compressor_type
argument.description: The compressor type of the heat pump. Only applies to air-to-air and mini-split. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_sensible_heat_fraction
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Cooling Sensible Heat Fraction
argument.description: The sensible heat fraction of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump, Packaged Terminal Heat Pump, Room Air Conditioner w/ Reverse Cycle, Ground-to-Air Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump, Packaged Terminal Heat Pump, Room Air Conditioner w/ Reverse Cycle, Ground-to-Air Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_autosizing_factor
argument.description: The capacity scaling factor applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, 1.0 is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_autosizing_limit
argument.description: The maximum capacity limit applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, no limit is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_capacity_retention_fraction
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Heating Capacity Retention Fraction
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the heat pump at a user-specified temperature (e.g., 17F or 5F) divided by the above nominal heating capacity. Applies to all heat pump types except ground-to-air. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump, Packaged Terminal Heat Pump, Room Air Conditioner w/ Reverse Cycle) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_heating_capacity_retention_temp
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Heating Capacity Retention Temperature
argument.description: The user-specified temperature (e.g., 17F or 5F) for the above heating capacity retention fraction. Applies to all heat pump types except ground-to-air. Required if the Heating Capacity Retention Fraction is provided.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_capacity
argument.description: The output cooling capacity of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump, Packaged Terminal Heat Pump, Room Air Conditioner w/ Reverse Cycle, Ground-to-Air Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_autosizing_factor
argument.description: The capacity scaling factor applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, 1.0 is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_cooling_autosizing_limit
argument.description: The maximum capacity limit applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, no limit is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heating load served by the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_fraction_cool_load_served
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Fraction Cool Load Served
argument.description: The cooling load served by the heat pump.

argument.name: heat_pump_compressor_lockout_temp
argument.description: The temperature below which the heat pump compressor is disabled. If both this and Backup Heating Lockout Temperature are provided and use the same value, it essentially defines a switchover temperature (for, e.g., a dual-fuel heat pump). Applies to all heat pump types other than ground-to-air. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump, Packaged Terminal Heat Pump, Room Air Conditioner w/ Reverse Cycle) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_type
argument.description: The backup type of the heat pump. If 'integrated', represents e.g. built-in electric strip heat or dual-fuel integrated furnace. If 'separate', represents e.g. electric baseboard or boiler based on the Heating System 2 specified below. Use 'none' if there is no backup heating.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_autosizing_factor
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Backup Heating Autosizing Factor
argument.description: The capacity scaling factor applied to the auto-sizing methodology if Backup Type is 'integrated'. If not provided, 1.0 is used. If Backup Type is 'separate', use Heating System 2: Heating Autosizing Factor.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_autosizing_limit
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Backup Heating Autosizing Limit
argument.description: The maximum capacity limit applied to the auto-sizing methodology if Backup Type is 'integrated'. If not provided, no limit is used. If Backup Type is 'separate', use Heating System 2: Heating Autosizing Limit.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_fuel
argument.description: The backup fuel type of the heat pump. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_efficiency
argument.description: The backup rated efficiency value of the heat pump. Percent for electricity fuel type. AFUE otherwise. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_capacity
argument.description: The backup output heating capacity of the heat pump. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see Backup) is used. Only applies if Backup Type is 'integrated'.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_heating_lockout_temp
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Backup Heating Lockout Temperature
argument.description: The temperature above which the heat pump backup system is disabled. If both this and Compressor Lockout Temperature are provided and use the same value, it essentially defines a switchover temperature (for, e.g., a dual-fuel heat pump). Applies for both Backup Type of 'integrated' and 'separate'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Backup) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_sizing_methodology
argument.description: The auto-sizing methodology to use when the heat pump capacity is not provided. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML HVAC Sizing Control) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_backup_sizing_methodology
argument.description: The auto-sizing methodology to use when the heat pump backup capacity is not provided. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML HVAC Sizing Control) is used.

argument.name: heat_pump_is_ducted
argument.description: Whether the heat pump is ducted or not. Only used for mini-split. It's assumed that air-to-air and ground-to-air are ducted, and packaged terminal heat pump and room air conditioner with reverse cycle are not ducted. If not provided, assumes not ducted.

argument.name: heat_pump_airflow_defect_ratio
argument.description: The airflow defect ratio, defined as (InstalledAirflow - DesignAirflow) / DesignAirflow, of the heat pump per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no airflow defect. Applies only to air-to-air, ducted mini-split, and ground-to-air. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: heat_pump_charge_defect_ratio
argument.description: The refrigerant charge defect ratio, defined as (InstalledCharge - DesignCharge) / DesignCharge, of the heat pump per ANSI/RESNET/ACCA Standard 310. A value of zero means no refrigerant charge defect. Applies to all heat pump types. If not provided, assumes no defect.

argument.name: heat_pump_crankcase_heater_watts
argument.display_name: Heat Pump: Crankcase Heater Power Watts
argument.description: Heat Pump crankcase heater power consumption in Watts. Applies only to air-to-air, mini-split, packaged terminal heat pump and room air conditioner with reverse cycle. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air-to-Air Heat Pump, Mini-Split Heat Pump, Packaged Terminal Heat Pump, Room Air Conditioner w/ Reverse Cycle) is used.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_capacity_type
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Capacity Type
argument.description: Type of capacity values for detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps).

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_heating_outdoor_temperatures
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Heating Outdoor Temperatures
argument.description: Outdoor temperatures of heating detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). One of the outdoor temperatures must be 47 F. At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_heating_min_speed_capacities
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Heating Minimum Speed Capacities
argument.description: Minimum speed capacities of heating detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_heating_max_speed_capacities
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Heating Maximum Speed Capacities
argument.description: Maximum speed capacities of heating detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_heating_min_speed_cops
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Heating Minimum Speed COPs
argument.description: Minimum speed efficiency COP values of heating detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_heating_max_speed_cops
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Heating Maximum Speed COPs
argument.description: Maximum speed efficiency COP values of heating detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_cooling_outdoor_temperatures
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Cooling Outdoor Temperatures
argument.description: Outdoor temperatures of cooling detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). One of the outdoor temperatures must be 95 F. At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_cooling_min_speed_capacities
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Cooling Minimum Speed Capacities
argument.description: Minimum speed capacities of cooling detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_cooling_max_speed_capacities
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Cooling Maximum Speed Capacities
argument.description: Maximum speed capacities of cooling detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_cooling_min_speed_cops
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Cooling Minimum Speed COPs
argument.description: Minimum speed efficiency COP values of cooling detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: hvac_perf_data_cooling_max_speed_cops
argument.display_name: HVAC Detailed Performance Data: Cooling Maximum Speed COPs
argument.description: Maximum speed efficiency COP values of cooling detailed performance data if available. Applies only to variable-speed air-source HVAC systems (central air conditioners, mini-split air conditioners, air-to-air heat pumps, and mini-split heat pumps). At least two performance data points are required using a comma-separated list.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_configuration
argument.description: Configuration of the geothermal loop. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Ground-to-Air Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_borefield_configuration
argument.description: Borefield configuration of the geothermal loop. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_loop_flow
argument.description: Water flow rate through the geothermal loop. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_boreholes_count
argument.description: Number of boreholes. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_boreholes_length
argument.description: Average length of each borehole (vertical). Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_boreholes_spacing
argument.description: Distance between bores. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_boreholes_diameter
argument.description: Diameter of bores. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_grout_type
argument.description: Grout type of the geothermal loop. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_pipe_type
argument.description: Pipe type of the geothermal loop. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: geothermal_loop_pipe_diameter
argument.description: Pipe diameter of the geothermal loop. Only applies to ground-to-air heat pump type. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Geothermal Loops) is used.

argument.name: heating_system_2_type
argument.description: The type of the second heating system. If a heat pump is specified and the backup type is 'separate', this heating system represents 'separate' backup heating. For ducted heat pumps where the backup heating system is a 'Furnace', the backup would typically be characterized as 'integrated' in that the furnace and heat pump share the same distribution system and blower fan; a 'Furnace' as 'separate' backup to a ducted heat pump is not supported.

argument.name: heating_system_2_fuel
argument.description: The fuel type of the second heating system. Ignored for ElectricResistance.

argument.name: heating_system_2_heating_efficiency
argument.display_name: Heating System 2: Rated AFUE or Percent
argument.description: The rated heating efficiency value of the second heating system.

argument.name: heating_system_2_heating_capacity
argument.description: The output heating capacity of the second heating system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML autosized default (see HPXML Heating Systems) is used.

argument.name: heating_system_2_heating_autosizing_factor
argument.description: The capacity scaling factor applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, 1.0 is used.

argument.name: heating_system_2_heating_autosizing_limit
argument.description: The maximum capacity limit applied to the auto-sizing methodology. If not provided, no limit is used.

argument.name: heating_system_2_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Heating System 2: Fraction Heat Load Served
argument.description: The heat load served fraction of the second heating system. Ignored if this heating system serves as a backup system for a heat pump.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Heating Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend heating setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekday_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekday Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekday cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_weekend_setpoint
argument.display_name: HVAC Control: Cooling Weekend Setpoint Schedule
argument.description: Specify the constant or 24-hour comma-separated weekend cooling setpoint schedule. Required unless a detailed CSV schedule is provided.

argument.name: hvac_control_heating_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Nov 1 - Jun 30'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML HVAC Control) is used. Can also provide 'BuildingAmerica' to use automatic seasons from the Building America House Simulation Protocols.

argument.name: hvac_control_cooling_season_period
argument.description: Enter a date range like 'Jun 1 - Oct 31'. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML HVAC Control) is used. Can also provide 'BuildingAmerica' to use automatic seasons from the Building America House Simulation Protocols.

argument.name: hvac_blower_fan_watts_per_cfm
argument.description: The blower fan efficiency at maximum fan speed. Applies only to split (not packaged) systems (i.e., applies to ducted systems as well as ductless mini-split systems). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Heating Systems, HPXML Cooling Systems, HPXML Heat Pumps) is used.

argument.name: ducts_leakage_units
argument.description: The leakage units of the ducts.

argument.name: ducts_supply_leakage_to_outside_value
argument.display_name: Ducts: Supply Leakage to Outside Value
argument.description: The leakage value to outside for the supply ducts.

argument.name: ducts_supply_location
argument.description: The location of the supply ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_supply_insulation_r
argument.description: The nominal insulation r-value of the supply ducts excluding air films. Use 0 for uninsulated ducts.

argument.name: ducts_supply_buried_insulation_level
argument.description: Whether the supply ducts are buried in, e.g., attic loose-fill insulation. Partially buried ducts have insulation that does not cover the top of the ducts. Fully buried ducts have insulation that just covers the top of the ducts. Deeply buried ducts have insulation that continues above the top of the ducts.

argument.name: ducts_supply_surface_area
argument.description: The supply ducts surface area in the given location. If neither Surface Area nor Area Fraction provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_supply_surface_area_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of supply ducts surface area in the given location. Only used if Surface Area is not provided. If the fraction is less than 1, the remaining duct area is assumed to be in conditioned space. If neither Surface Area nor Area Fraction provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_supply_fraction_rectangular
argument.description: The fraction of supply ducts that are rectangular (as opposed to round); this affects the duct effective R-value used for modeling. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_leakage_to_outside_value
argument.display_name: Ducts: Return Leakage to Outside Value
argument.description: The leakage value to outside for the return ducts.

argument.name: ducts_return_location
argument.description: The location of the return ducts. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_insulation_r
argument.description: The nominal insulation r-value of the return ducts excluding air films. Use 0 for uninsulated ducts.

argument.name: ducts_return_buried_insulation_level
argument.description: Whether the return ducts are buried in, e.g., attic loose-fill insulation. Partially buried ducts have insulation that does not cover the top of the ducts. Fully buried ducts have insulation that just covers the top of the ducts. Deeply buried ducts have insulation that continues above the top of the ducts.

argument.name: ducts_return_surface_area
argument.description: The return ducts surface area in the given location. If neither Surface Area nor Area Fraction provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_surface_area_fraction
argument.description: The fraction of return ducts surface area in the given location. Only used if Surface Area is not provided. If the fraction is less than 1, the remaining duct area is assumed to be in conditioned space. If neither Surface Area nor Area Fraction provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_number_of_return_registers
argument.description: The number of return registers of the ducts. Only used to calculate default return duct surface area. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: ducts_return_fraction_rectangular
argument.description: The fraction of return ducts that are rectangular (as opposed to round); this affects the duct effective R-value used for modeling. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Air Distribution) is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_fan_type
argument.description: The type of the mechanical ventilation. Use 'none' if there is no mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: mech_vent_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the mechanical ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Mechanical Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the mechanical ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Mechanical Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_recovery_efficiency_type
argument.display_name: Mechanical Ventilation: Total Recovery Efficiency Type
argument.description: The total recovery efficiency type of the mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_total_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted total recovery efficiency of the mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_sensible_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted sensible recovery efficiency of the mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator and heat recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the mechanical ventilation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Mechanical Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: mech_vent_num_units_served
argument.display_name: Mechanical Ventilation: Number of Units Served
argument.description: Number of dwelling units served by the mechanical ventilation system. Must be 1 if single-family detached. Used to apportion flow rate and fan power to the unit.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_frac_recirculation
argument.description: Fraction of the total supply air that is recirculated, with the remainder assumed to be outdoor air. The value must be 0 for exhaust only systems. Required for a shared mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_preheating_fuel
argument.description: Fuel type of the preconditioning heating equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no preheating.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_preheating_efficiency
argument.description: Efficiency of the preconditioning heating equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no preheating.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_preheating_fraction_heat_load_served
argument.display_name: Shared Mechanical Ventilation: Preheating Fraction Ventilation Heat Load Served
argument.description: Fraction of heating load introduced by the shared ventilation system that is met by the preconditioning heating equipment. If not provided, assumes no preheating.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_precooling_fuel
argument.description: Fuel type of the preconditioning cooling equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no precooling.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_precooling_efficiency
argument.description: Efficiency of the preconditioning cooling equipment. Only used for a shared mechanical ventilation system. If not provided, assumes no precooling.

argument.name: mech_vent_shared_precooling_fraction_cool_load_served
argument.display_name: Shared Mechanical Ventilation: Precooling Fraction Ventilation Cool Load Served
argument.description: Fraction of cooling load introduced by the shared ventilation system that is met by the preconditioning cooling equipment. If not provided, assumes no precooling.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_fan_type
argument.description: The type of the second mechanical ventilation. Use 'none' if there is no second mechanical ventilation system.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_recovery_efficiency_type
argument.display_name: Mechanical Ventilation 2: Total Recovery Efficiency Type
argument.description: The total recovery efficiency type of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_total_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted total recovery efficiency of the second mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_sensible_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: The Unadjusted or Adjusted sensible recovery efficiency of the second mechanical ventilation. Applies to energy recovery ventilator and heat recovery ventilator.

argument.name: mech_vent_2_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the second mechanical ventilation.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_quantity
argument.description: The quantity of the kitchen fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_power
argument.description: The fan power of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: kitchen_fans_start_hour
argument.description: The start hour of the kitchen fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_quantity
argument.description: The quantity of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_hours_in_operation
argument.description: The hours in operation of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_power
argument.description: The fan power of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: bathroom_fans_start_hour
argument.description: The start hour of the bathroom fans. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Local Ventilation Fans) is used.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_present
argument.description: Whether there is a whole house fan.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_flow_rate
argument.description: The flow rate of the whole house fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Whole House Fans) is used.

argument.name: whole_house_fan_power
argument.description: The fan power of the whole house fan. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Whole House Fans) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_type
argument.description: The type of water heater. Use 'none' if there is no water heater.

argument.name: water_heater_fuel_type
argument.description: The fuel type of water heater. Ignored for heat pump water heater.

argument.name: water_heater_location
argument.description: The location of water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Water Heating Systems) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_tank_volume
argument.description: Nominal volume of water heater tank. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage, Heat Pump, Combi Boiler w/ Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_efficiency_type
argument.description: The efficiency type of water heater. Does not apply to space-heating boilers.

argument.name: water_heater_efficiency
argument.description: Rated Energy Factor or Uniform Energy Factor. Does not apply to space-heating boilers.

argument.name: water_heater_usage_bin
argument.description: The usage of the water heater. Only applies if Efficiency Type is UniformEnergyFactor and Type is not instantaneous water heater. Does not apply to space-heating boilers. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage, Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_recovery_efficiency
argument.description: Ratio of energy delivered to water heater to the energy content of the fuel consumed by the water heater. Only used for non-electric storage water heaters. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_heating_capacity
argument.description: Heating capacity. Only applies to storage water heater and heat pump water heater (compressor). If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage, Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_backup_heating_capacity
argument.description: Backup heating capacity for a heat pump water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_standby_loss
argument.description: The standby loss of water heater. Only applies to space-heating boilers. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Combi Boiler w/ Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_jacket_rvalue
argument.description: The jacket R-value of water heater. Doesn't apply to instantaneous water heater or space-heating boiler with tankless coil. If not provided, defaults to no jacket insulation.

argument.name: water_heater_setpoint_temperature
argument.description: The setpoint temperature of water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Water Heating Systems) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_num_bedrooms_served
argument.display_name: Water Heater: Number of Bedrooms Served
argument.description: Number of bedrooms served (directly or indirectly) by the water heater. Only needed if single-family attached or apartment unit and it is a shared water heater serving multiple dwelling units. Used to apportion water heater tank losses to the unit.

argument.name: water_heater_uses_desuperheater
argument.description: Requires that the dwelling unit has a air-to-air, mini-split, or ground-to-air heat pump or a central air conditioner or mini-split air conditioner. If not provided, assumes no desuperheater.

argument.name: water_heater_tank_model_type
argument.description: Type of tank model to use. The 'stratified' tank generally provide more accurate results, but may significantly increase run time. Applies only to storage water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Conventional Storage) is used.

argument.name: water_heater_operating_mode
argument.description: The water heater operating mode. The 'heat pump only' option only uses the heat pump, while 'hybrid/auto' allows the backup electric resistance to come on in high demand situations. This is ignored if a scheduled operating mode type is selected. Applies only to heat pump water heater. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Heat Pump) is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_system_type
argument.description: The type of the hot water distribution system.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_standard_piping_length
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Standard Piping Length
argument.description: If the distribution system is Standard, the length of the piping. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Standard) is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_control_type
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Control Type
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the type of hot water recirculation control, if any.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_piping_length
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Piping Length
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the length of the recirculation piping. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Recirculation (In-Unit)) is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_branch_piping_length
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Branch Piping Length
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the length of the recirculation branch piping. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Recirculation (In-Unit)) is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_recirc_pump_power
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Recirculation Pump Power
argument.description: If the distribution system is Recirculation, the recirculation pump power. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Recirculation (In-Unit)) is used.

argument.name: hot_water_distribution_pipe_r
argument.display_name: Hot Water Distribution: Pipe Insulation Nominal R-Value
argument.description: Nominal R-value of the pipe insulation. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Hot Water Distribution) is used.

argument.name: dwhr_facilities_connected
argument.display_name: Drain Water Heat Recovery: Facilities Connected
argument.description: Which facilities are connected for the drain water heat recovery. Use 'none' if there is no drain water heat recovery system.

argument.name: dwhr_equal_flow
argument.display_name: Drain Water Heat Recovery: Equal Flow
argument.description: Whether the drain water heat recovery has equal flow.

argument.name: dwhr_efficiency
argument.description: The efficiency of the drain water heat recovery.

argument.name: water_fixtures_shower_low_flow
argument.display_name: Hot Water Fixtures: Is Shower Low Flow
argument.description: Whether the shower fixture is low flow.

argument.name: water_fixtures_sink_low_flow
argument.display_name: Hot Water Fixtures: Is Sink Low Flow
argument.description: Whether the sink fixture is low flow.

argument.name: water_fixtures_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on the hot water usage that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Water Fixtures) is used.

argument.name: general_water_use_usage_multiplier
argument.description: Multiplier on internal gains from general water use (floor mopping, shower evaporation, water films on showers, tubs & sinks surfaces, plant watering, etc.) that can reflect, e.g., high/low usage occupants. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Building Occupancy) is used.

argument.name: solar_thermal_system_type
argument.description: The type of solar thermal system. Use 'none' if there is no solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_area
argument.description: The collector area of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_loop_type
argument.description: The collector loop type of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_type
argument.description: The collector type of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_azimuth
argument.description: The collector azimuth of the solar thermal system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_tilt
argument.description: The collector tilt of the solar thermal system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_rated_optical_efficiency
argument.display_name: Solar Thermal: Collector Rated Optical Efficiency
argument.description: The collector rated optical efficiency of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_collector_rated_thermal_losses
argument.display_name: Solar Thermal: Collector Rated Thermal Losses
argument.description: The collector rated thermal losses of the solar thermal system.

argument.name: solar_thermal_storage_volume
argument.description: The storage volume of the solar thermal system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see Detailed Inputs) is used.

argument.name: solar_thermal_solar_fraction
argument.description: The solar fraction of the solar thermal system. If provided, overrides all other solar thermal inputs.

argument.name: pv_system_present
argument.description: Whether there is a PV system present.

argument.name: pv_system_module_type
argument.description: Module type of the PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Photovoltaics) is used.

argument.name: pv_system_location
argument.description: Location of the PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Photovoltaics) is used.

argument.name: pv_system_tracking
argument.description: Type of tracking for the PV system. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Photovoltaics) is used.

argument.name: pv_system_array_azimuth
argument.description: Array azimuth of the PV system. Azimuth is measured clockwise from north (e.g., North=0, East=90, South=180, West=270).

argument.name: pv_system_array_tilt
argument.description: Array tilt of the PV system. Can also enter, e.g., RoofPitch, RoofPitch+20, Latitude, Latitude-15, etc.

argument.name: pv_system_max_power_output
argument.description: Maximum power output of the PV system. For a shared system, this is the total building maximum power output.

argument.name: pv_system_inverter_efficiency
argument.description: Inverter efficiency of the PV system. If there are two PV systems, this will apply to both. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Photovoltaics) is used.

argument.name: pv_system_system_losses_fraction
argument.description: System losses fraction of the PV system. If there are two PV systems, this will apply to both. If not provided, the OS-HPXML default (see HPXML Photovoltaics) is used.

argument.name: pv_system_num_bedrooms_served
argument.display_name: PV System: Number of Bedrooms Served
argument.description: Number of bedrooms served by PV system. Only needed if single-family attached or apartment unit and it is a shared PV system serving multiple dwelling units. Used to apportion PV generation to the unit of a SFA/MF building. If there are two PV systems, this will apply to both.

argument.name: pv_system_2_present
argument.description: Whether there is a second PV system present.

argument.name: pv_system_2_module_type
